intro: Hieracium fastuosum, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with erect, hairy stems and alternate, heart-shaped leaves. Its most striking feature is its showy yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium fastuosum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes.
